metadata.title: CVE-2024-6232 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a MEDIUM severity vulnerability affecting CPython.Regular expressions that allowed excessive backtracking duringtarfile.TarFile header parsing are vulnerable to ReDoS viaspecifically-crafted tar archives.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21').
python3.4 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm3').
